title: Ecosystem Overfishing Ideas
text: Ci=PP.TEiTLi−1C_i = PP.TE_i^{TL_i-1} CiC_i = maximum productivity species , TETE = trophic efficiency species , TLTL = trophic level species . PP assmed net primary productivity fixed time space total productivity system n species C=∑inPP.TEiTLi−1C = \sum_i^n PP.TE_i^{TL_i-1} TETE often assumed 10% -16% TLTL system often assumed 3-4 (global average ~3.4) interested global estimates. interested regional specific estimates. scalar, α\alpha, often included represent proportion C available harvest. Studies point using value 0.15-.2 C=α∑inPP.TEiTLi−1C = \alpha \sum_i^n PP.TE_i^{TL_i-1} CC represents total catch system

title: Ecosystem Overfishing Ideas
text: Using (see Link Watson info) PP=45GtCyear−1PP = 45Gt C year{-1}, TE=12TE =12%, α=.15\alpha = .15, TL=3.4TL = 3.4 yields value C=.42Gtyear−1C = .42 Gt year^{-1}. (Total removals ocean) Ryther index (tkm−2year−1t km^{-2} year^{-1}) - total removal per unit area. global scale, total surface area ocean ~ 361 million km−2km^{-2} Upper bound Ryther threshold calculated : Ryther = .42Gtyear−1109361km−2106=1.14tkm−2year−1\frac{.42 Gt year^{-1} 10^9}{361 km^{-2}10^6} = 1.14 t km^{-2}year^{-1} represent current state fishing worldwide considered acceptable upper bound (based values PP, TE, TL, α\alpha). thresholds calculated based varying values. can calculate envelope using range TL, TE, PP, α\alpha values.

title: Ecosystem Overfishing Ideas
text: Ecodata 2022. Thresholds based global estimates primary production. Threshold = .276 (PP = 400, alpha = 0.1, TE = .1, TL = 3.6) Threshold = 1.14 (PP = 450, alpha = 0.15, TE = .12, TL = 3.4) Threshold = 2.73 (PP = 500, alpha = 0.15, TE = .14, TL = 3.2) Threshold = 3.64 (PP = 500, alpha = 0.20, TE = .14, TL = 3.2)

title: Ecosystem Overfishing Ideas
text: Ecodata 2022. Thresholds based regional estimates primary production. Threshold = .68 (PP = 400, alpha = 0.1, TE = .1, TL = 3.6) Threshold = 2.8 (PP = 450, alpha = 0.15, TE = .12, TL = 3.4) Threshold = 6.72 (PP = 500, alpha = 0.15, TE = .14, TL = 3.2) Threshold = 8.96 (PP = 500, alpha = 0.20, TE = .14, TL = 3.2) Calculate regional footprint using PP, TL information region, relying Global estimates, since different areas world /less productive others.

title: Ecosystem Overfishing Ideas
text: need estimate PP tCyear−1t C year^{-1} NEUS region base estimating system productivity. Note: Global estimate PP = 40-50 Gt C year−1year^{-1} (Giga tons= 10^9 tons) primary production (PP) NEUS atlantis model forced. Data annual currentVersion/tsfiles/Annual_Files/Phyto_Forcing_xxxx.nc nc files nc file contains three phytoplankton functional groups. present top layer box (euphotic zone, boxes upper 50m layer) NA’s elsewhere Micro phytoplankton (> 20 μm\mu m) - Split Atlantis Diatoms Atlantis Dinoflagellates (Large) Nano phytoplankton (2-20 μm\mu m) (Medium) - Atlantis pico Pico phytoplankton (< 2 μm\mu m) (Small) - Atlantis pico Currently large phytoplankton (Diatoms) pathway upper part foodweb Atlantis. Dont consider Atlantis’s dinoflagellates (harmful algal blooms) pico part primary production available diatoms (1 mm) dinoflagellates (.015-.04 mm) picophytoplankton (0.2-10 μ\mum) - 70% productivity Units = mgNm−3mg N m^{-3} Dinoflagellates consumed filter feeders (deposit feeders, DF, benthic filter feeders, BFF, atlantic states demersal fish, SDF) bacteria pico phytoplankton consumed small zooplankton consumed Meso zooplankton (ZM, Copepods) consumed krill. Diatoms consumed meso zooplankton (ZM), large zooplankton (ZL), planktivores (MAK, , MEN) Read nc file using ncdf4::open.nc() R package rbgm get mgNm−3mg N m^{-3} mgNmg N box (rbgm::bgmfile(file)) need read , combine convert tonsCunitArea−1year−1tons C unitArea^{-1} year^{-1} Always Carbon Nitrogen organic matter. C:N 5.7 used atlantis.

title: Ecosystem Overfishing Ideas
text: Atlantis boxes mapped NEUS EPUs (see Caracappa et al)  MAB ~= 117861 km2km^2 following plots use NEUS spatial footprint (Boxes 1:22) ~ 264,000 km2km^{2}

title: Ecosystem Overfishing Ideas
text: Using three values system PP. Min, mean, max annual time series Values Primary production = 3.0775844^{8}, 3.6174809^{8}, 4.0002739^{8} area MAB atlantis = 1.1807533^{5} Using values “centroid” values (term used Link et al) TL = 3.4, TE = .12, alpha = .15. Compare upper threshold 1.14 t km-2 year-1 based Global estimates PP. Much higher thresholds.

title: Ecosystem Overfishing Ideas
text: Defintion: TLi=1+∑jTLjFijTL_i= 1 + \sum_jTL_jF_{ij} predator , prey j. FijF_{ij} fraction j diet matrix form: [TL1TL2TL3...TLn]=[111...1]+[F11F12F13...F1nF21F22F23...F2nF31F32F33...F3n...Fn1Fn2Fn3...Fnn][TL1TL2TL3...TLn] \begin{bmatrix} TL_{1} \\ TL_{2} \\ TL_{3} \\ ...\\ TL_{n} \\ \end{bmatrix} = \begin{bmatrix} 1 \\ 1 \\ 1 \\ ...\\ 1 \\ \end{bmatrix} + \begin{bmatrix} F_{11} & F_{12} & F_{13} & ... &  F_{1n} \\ F_{21} & F_{22} & F_{23} & ... &  F_{2n} \\ F_{31} & F_{32} & F_{33} & ... &  F_{3n}  \\ ...\\ F_{n1} & F_{n2} & F_{n3} & ... &  F_{nn}  \\ \end{bmatrix} \begin{bmatrix} TL_{1} \\ TL_{2} \\ TL_{3} \\ ...\\ TL_{n} \\ \end{bmatrix} simplifies TL=1T+F.TLTL−F.TL=1T(−F)TL=1TTL=(−F)−11T \begin{align} TL &= 1^T + F.TL \\ TL - F .TL &= 1^T \\ (-F)TL &= 1^T \\ TL &= (-F)^{-1}1^T \end{align} several options calculate trophic level Pull species trophic level data fishbase Estimate species trophic level atlantis input params (pprey values denote prey preference) Estimate species trophic level atlantis realized diet output Assume system wide average trophic level (Stock et al.) calculate : Primary production required support total catch TLeq equal primary production required based summing individual catch ∑=1nCi(1TE)TLi−1=(∑=1nCi)1TETLeq−1\sum_{=1}^n C_i \left(\frac{1}{TE}\right)^{TL_i -1} = \left(\sum_{=1}^n C_i \right)\frac{1}{TE}^{TL_{eq}-1} easier said done. Atlantis outputs consumption predator prey, box, time detailedDietCheck.txt can large file ~ 27GB can read R without first processing outside R. Alternatively, consumption can obtained prod.nc file used combination dietData.txtfile. Functions edit_param_pprey -> get_pprey_values R directory repo tp pull prrey values biology.prm file Processed Atlantis output data_dietcheck.rds columns: time, pred, agecl (pred), prey, atoutput (units)
